lawnlayer

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • lawnlayer.GameObject
      • lawnlayer.Agent
        • lawnlayer.Player

  • public class Player
extends Agent
    Represents a player object that the user controls.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class lawnlayer.Agent

      • isInSoil

        public boolean isInSoil()
        Gets if the player is in the soil area. The soil area is also refered as game area or play area for this documentation. It is the zone where the player can lay path, fill grass, and get attacked.
        Returns:
        true if player in soil, otherwise false

      • setPathCorner

        public void setPathCorner(boolean value)
        Sets the player to be at a path corner or not. This is for test cases only. No other classes should be able to manually override player state.
        Parameters:
        value - true if at path corner, otherwise false

        Gets if player is at a path corner
        Returns:
        true if player at path corner, otherwise false

      • tick

        public void tick(App gameboard)
        Updates this player's movement and action. Called every frame.

        The player starts laying down a path behind itself when it enters the soil area. It checks enclosed areas and fills grass when it enters safe zone (grass or concrete). Certain surrounding tiles are used to track the player's path. Updates the game's current score when new grass is filled. See App.updateScore().

        The player can die(App) in the soil area if it hits its own path. Or if a propogating red path catches up and hits the player. See propogate(TileObject, TileObject) and initialPropogate(TileObject).

        Parameters:
        gameboard - the current gameboard
        See Also:
        Agent.getSurroundingTiles(TileObject[][], TileObject), setFrontBackTile(HashMap)

      • move

        public void move(int x,
                 int y)
        Updates the player's location based on its movements. The movements are determined via the user's key controls. Snaps the player to boundaries if it is at any of the wall edges, with the function defined in its parent class Agent.
        Parameters:
        x - the current x-coordinate of this player
        y - the current y-coordinate of this player

      • checkPlayerInSoil

        public void checkPlayerInSoil()
        Checks if this player is in soil area. Does not directly check if the player's tile is a soil tile. Instead, checks if the player's tile is not a safe tile (grass or concrete). Because the player's tile can be a path tile.

      • snapToGrid

        public void snapToGrid()
        Snaps this player to the center of the tile. Ensures the player is always visually aligned with the grid map.

      • setFrontBackTile

        public void setFrontBackTile(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,TileObject> surroundingTiles)
        Sets the front and back tiles of this player, based on the 8 tiles surrounding this player. See Agent.getSurroundingTiles(TileObject[][], TileObject).
        Parameters:
        surroundingTiles - the 8 tiles surrounding this player

      • updatePath

        public void updatePath()
        Updates the path tile. Sets the back tile of this player to be a path tile. If the player is at a turning corner, sets the player's tile to be a path tile.
        See Also:
        TileObject.setPath()

      • die

        public Player die(App gameboard)
        Removes this player and spawns in a new player. Deducts a life.
        Parameters:
        gameboard - the current gameboard
        Returns:
        the new player
        See Also:
        App.newPlayer(), App.modifyLife(int)

      • initialPropogate

        public void initialPropogate(TileObject hitTile)
        Starts the propogation of red path. Marks the neighboring tiles as the next 2 tiles to set as red path. See TileObject.setPathHit().
        Parameters:
        hitTile - the tile that was hit by Enemy

      • propogate

        public void propogate(TileObject hitTileStart,
                      TileObject hitTileEnd)
        Sets the 2 marked tiles as red path. Marks another 2 neighboring tiles as the next 2 red path tiles. See TileObject.setPathHit().
        Parameters:
        hitTileStart - the front tile to be set as red path (towards player)
        hitTileEnd - the tail tile to be set as red path (away from player)

      • fillGrass

        public void fillGrass(TileObject[][] map,
                      TileObject[] allTileObjects,
                      java.util.List<Enemy> enemies)
        Checks areas enclosed by the player's path laid and fills areas with grass.

        Uses the flood fill algorithm to find enclosed areas. Starts the searches from the 2 tail corners of the player.

        If both corners are soil, search twice starting from both corner tiles.

        If either corner is soil, search once starting from the soil tile.

        If both corners are not soil, simply fill the path with grass and return. (Edge case: Not optimal but safer than starting flood fill from any soil tile. Wrong areas can be marked and filled.)

        The case of only 1 area with all soil tiles included is possible, when the path does not properly enclose two areas. Ideally, there are 2 enclosed areas.

        1. Both areas with enemies: fill the path only
        2. Or fill either side without enemies
        In both conditions, the path tiles are filled with grass too. After filling grass, clear the list of path tiles and both enclosed areas.

        Parameters:
        map - the current 2d tilemap
        allTileObjects - all tile objects in the tilemap
        enemies - the list of enemies
        See Also:
        getEncloseArea(TileObject[][], int, int, List), TileObject.setGrass(), setFrontBackTile(HashMap)

      • getEncloseArea

        public void getEncloseArea(TileObject[][] map,
                           int curRow,
                           int curCol,
                           java.util.List<TileObject> list)
        Recursively searches the 4 neighboring tiles of the current tile. The base case is when it hits the walls of the game area, or any tile that is not soil.
        Parameters:
        map - the current 2d tilemap
        curRow - the current row of recursion
        curCol - the current column of recursion
        list - the area list to which the marked tiles are added

      • resetKey

        public void resetKey()
        Resets all movement keys.

      • pressUp

        public void pressUp()
        This player moves up. Called if UP key is pressed. Player is not allowed diagonal movement.

        When the player is in grass or soil area, it is not allowed to backtrack. The player snapToGrid() when it changes direction in grass or soil, and a path corner is marked. This affects setFrontBackTile(HashMap).

        See Also:
        App.keyPressed()

      • pressRight

        public void pressRight()
        This player moves right. Called if RIGHT key is pressed. Player is not allowed diagonal movement.

        When the player is in grass or soil area, it is not allowed to backtrack. The player snapToGrid() when it changes direction in grass or soil, and a path corner is marked. This affects setFrontBackTile(HashMap).

        See Also:
        App.keyPressed()

      • pressDown

        public void pressDown()
        This player moves down. Called if DOWN key is pressed. Player is not allowed diagonal movement.

        When the player is in grass or soil area, it is not allowed to backtrack. The player snapToGrid() when it changes direction in grass or soil, and a path corner is marked. This affects setFrontBackTile(HashMap).

        See Also:
        App.keyPressed()

      • pressLeft

        public void pressLeft()
        This player moves left. Called if LEFT key is pressed. Player is not allowed diagonal movement.

        When the player is in grass or soil area, it is not allowed to backtrack. The player snapToGrid() when it changes direction in grass or soil, and a path corner is marked. This affects setFrontBackTile(HashMap).

        See Also:
        App.keyPressed()

      • releaseUp

        public void releaseUp()
        Stops moving up and snapToGrid(). If this player is in grass or soil area, the player continues movement.

      • releaseRight

        public void releaseRight()
        Stops moving right and snapToGrid(). If this player is in grass or soil area, the player continues movement.

      • releaseDown

        public void releaseDown()
        Stops moving down and snapToGrid(). If this player is in grass or soil area, the player continues movement.

      • releaseLeft

        public void releaseLeft()
        Stops moving left and snapToGrid(). If this player is in grass or soil area, the player continues movement.
